Package main

Class MoveableTile

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.MapElement
      • main.Tile
        • main.MoveableTile
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Crate, Player
    public abstract class MoveableTile
extends Tile

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      MoveableTile​(int xCoord, int yCoord, java.lang.String tileImage, java.lang.String tileType)  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean canCrateMove​(int xCoord, int yCoord, int direction)
      Checks if the crate can be moved by checking if the tile in the direction specified is not a wall or another crate
      boolean doWeNeedToPlaceADiamond​(int xCoord, int yCoord)
      Checks if a diamond tile needs to be placed instead of a floor tile (since floor/diamond tiles are technically deleted when a crate moves onto them)
      boolean generalMovementHandler​(int xCoord, int yCoord, int direction)
      This is the general movement handler, it helps move the player and crates around This returns true or false based on if the player can move in the direction requested
      javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle getObjectInGridPane​(int xCoord, int yCoord)
      This method checks the entire gridpane for a matching object I got this partially from a StackOverflow Answer (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/20655024/javafx-gridpane-retrieve-specific-cell-content)
      boolean isCrateInWay​(int xCoord, int yCoord, int direction)
      Checks if there is a crate in the direction that the player wants to go
      boolean isDirectionPossible​(int xCoord, int yCoord, int direction)
      Checks if the direction is possible (IE, is there a wall in the way)
      void moveCrate​(int xCoord, int yCoord, int direction)
      This method moves the crate by deleting the tile that is moving to, then placing the crate onto the now blank tile It also places a floor tile on the location where the crate was previously, unless the tile was a diamond previously Then it places a diamond tile

      • getObjectInGridPane

        public javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle getObjectInGridPane​(int xCoord,
                                                        int yCoord)
        This method checks the entire gridpane for a matching object I got this partially from a StackOverflow Answer (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/20655024/javafx-gridpane-retrieve-specific-cell-content)
        Parameters:
        xCoord - Coord that we want to check
        yCoord - Coord that we want to check
        Returns:
        Returns rectangle object at those coords

      • generalMovementHandler

        public boolean generalMovementHandler​(int xCoord,
                                      int yCoord,
                                      int direction)
        This is the general movement handler, it helps move the player and crates around This returns true or false based on if the player can move in the direction requested
        Parameters:
        xCoord - Coord we are checking
        yCoord - Coord we are checking
        direction - Direction we are checking
        Returns:
        Returns true if a player and/or crate can move, else false

      • canCrateMove

        public boolean canCrateMove​(int xCoord,
                            int yCoord,
                            int direction)
        Checks if the crate can be moved by checking if the tile in the direction specified is not a wall or another crate
        Parameters:
        xCoord - Coord we are checking
        yCoord - Coord we are checking
        direction - Direction we are checking
        Returns:
        Returns true if the crate can move, else false

      • doWeNeedToPlaceADiamond

        public boolean doWeNeedToPlaceADiamond​(int xCoord,
                                       int yCoord)
        Checks if a diamond tile needs to be placed instead of a floor tile (since floor/diamond tiles are technically deleted when a crate moves onto them)
        Parameters:
        xCoord - xCoord of where we are checking
        yCoord - yCoord of where we are checking
        Returns:
        True if we do need a place a tile, else false

      • moveCrate

        public void moveCrate​(int xCoord,
                      int yCoord,
                      int direction)
        This method moves the crate by deleting the tile that is moving to, then placing the crate onto the now blank tile It also places a floor tile on the location where the crate was previously, unless the tile was a diamond previously Then it places a diamond tile
        Parameters:
        xCoord - Coord of where we are checking
        yCoord - Coord of where we are checking
        direction - Direction we are checking

      • isCrateInWay

        public boolean isCrateInWay​(int xCoord,
                            int yCoord,
                            int direction)
        Checks if there is a crate in the direction that the player wants to go
        Parameters:
        xCoord - Coord of where we are checking
        yCoord - Coord of where we are checking
        direction - Direction we are checking
        Returns:
        True if there is a crate in the way, else false

      • isDirectionPossible

        public boolean isDirectionPossible​(int xCoord,
                                   int yCoord,
                                   int direction)
        Checks if the direction is possible (IE, is there a wall in the way)
        Parameters:
        xCoord - Coord of where we are checking
        yCoord - Coord of where we are checking
        direction - Direction we are checking
        Returns:
        Returns true if the direction is possible, else false
